Countries that use the Hungarian forint

The Hungarian forint was established in 1946 as an official national currency and is used only in Hungary. It replaced the previously valid Hungarian pengő. 1 Forint is devided into 100 Fillér.

Currency reserves for the Hungarian forint

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to HUF 44.715 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 16.143 trillion forints. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:2.8. Or in other words, 10 of 28 forints are deposited with a countervalue, which is internationally already above average.

Approximately 691.49 billion forints (4.3%) of the currency reserves exist in gold reserves. The remainder consists of foreign currencies, special drawing rights in the International Monetary Fund and other reserve positions.
